profileAlternative.name: Dirk Eddelbuettel
profileAlternative.headline: Quantitative Research, Development and Trading / Data Science / Machine Learning
profileAlternative.summary:
Quantitative Research and Trading Professional with extensive experience in statistical / automated high-frequency automated trading strategies. (Adjunct) Clinical Professor of Statistics at the University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign. Open Source Contributor and Debian Developer. Expert R User and Package Author. R Foundation Board Member. Ph.D. in Financial Econometrics from EHESS - Ecole des Hautes Etudes en Sciences Sociales.

If you and I have never met or worked on anything. please do not send me a connection invite. Thank you.

positions.title: Senior Quantitative Developer
positions.description: Quantitative research and development for automated high-frequency trading and market-making , feature engieering, feature selection, data science, statistics, machine learning, econometrics, C++, R, Linux

positions.title: Clinical Professor
positions.description:
Clinical Professor of Statistics and Data Science, Department of Statistics.
Currently in an adjunct role at 25%.

positions.title: Contributor, Package Author and R Foundation Board Member
positions.companyName: The R Project for Statistical Computing

positions.title: Developer / Maintainer
positions.description: Responsible for a number of quantitative software packages (R and numerous R packages, GSL, QuantLib)

educations.title: EHESS - Ecole des Hautes Etudes en Sciences Sociales
EHESS - Ecole des Hautes Etudes en Sciences Sociales

given.text: Dirk is a very sharp R and C++ developper. We have been working together for years in various open source projects. The largest of these projects (Rcpp) is being used by a large number of R programmers

received.text: Our international conference on R in Finance not only keeps getting bigger and bigger -- but thanks to the unsurpassed work of Mary and her team at UIC also keeps running smoother and smoother.  An unmatched attention to even the smallest details is complemented by answering and even anticipating almost all of the organizing committee's needs.  We could hardly do it with her!

items: Seamless R and C++ Integration with Rcpp

peopleAlsoViewed.text: MBA Candidate at Kellogg School of Management
Algorithmic Trader at Vector Trading, LLC
Quantitative Analyst at NISA Investment Advisors, LLC
Chief Technology Officer at Consolidated Trading LLC
Low Latency Trading Infrastructure Engineer at Consolidated Trading LLC

volunteerExperience.title: Contributor / Package Author / Foundation Board Member
